revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TQ2G63GFR; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Wistron NeWeb DNXB-30 |rad1modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43465; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 4 |rad1rxchains = 4 |rad1sstreams = 4 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam1 = 800 |rad1n = 600 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = Wistron NeWeb DNXB-30 |rad2modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43465; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 4 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam2 = <!-- AC-qam --> |rad2ac = 1733 |rad2n = 600 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|rad3mod = Wistron NeWeb DNXB-31 |rad3modif = Mini PCIe |rad3chip1 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |rad3chip1brand = Broadcom |rad3chip1model = BCM43162 |rad3chip1modelfull = <!-- radio3 chip1 full info --> |rad3oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad3_ant_conn = U.FL |rad3txchains = 1 |rad3rxchains = 1 |rad3sstreams = 1 |rad3stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |rad3ac = <!-- 433, 867, 1300, 1733, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad3n = <!-- 150, 300, 450, 600, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad3g = <!-- 54, 108, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad3b = <!-- 11, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad3a = <!-- 54, Maximum throughput rated at --> |rad3freq = 2.4 or 5 |rad3correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad3cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The datasheet seems to claim 802.11ac support at 2.4GHz with proprietary clients saying, "2.4GHz: 4x4:4 802.11b/g/n/ac up to 800 Mbps data rate. 802.11ac for VHT capable Proprietary clients."
Mist calls this a tri-radio device which refers to the fact that it has three radios. The third radio is used for "2.4 GHz & 5 GHz dual-band WIDS/WIPS, spectrum analysis & location analytics," not for clients. This scanning radio uses a BCM43465 and a [https://www.skyworksinc.com/en/Products/Front-end-Modules/SKY85806-11 Skyworks SKY85806-11] front end.
8-pin [[IoT]] terminal block
==Links of Interest== [https://www.mist.com/wp-content/uploads/Mist-AP41-Datasheet.pdf Datasheet]
